Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but thrills unlikely!”
Reviews.Author: Acidinmyfridge
Reviews.Content: I know many people have rated this hotel as a "good / decent" business hotel, I am not sure if there was any change recently, but what I saw was below average. Key turn-off was the cleanliness of the room: hair on the (dirty) rug, stains on the bed sheets, yellowish curtains...YUK. Staff was rather rude and un-helping, answering "NO" before even getting the questions right... Frankly speaking, this is not a nice business stay for the money. There are better (and cleaner!) options on Nathan Road. Only positive point though was the relative spaciousness of the rooms (space is tight in HK!).

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ChaseMome
Reviews.Content: I went there with my parent and brother. the hotel is great . walking distance to MTR. either Prince Edward or Mon kok East.. near a string of restaurants. The Bed and Bathroom is just right. clean and spacious for two Asian adult. definitely going back there. forgot to take pictures. maybe next time:-)

Reviews.Title: “Good place,good view,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chimotz
Reviews.Content: we stay here for 3 nights.great place,good value for money,near ladies market. clean,friendly reception staff,near MTR,safety deposit fro each rooms, only 5 minutes by walking, good view from my room. Poor internet (have to pay $ 80 hongkong for 1 night), breakfast not to good.

Reviews.Title: “More than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: kenshen
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via a travel agent here in Manila. Cheap compared to other hotels of the same "quality range". It's about 5-10 mins walk to the MTR station. For the price I was expecting a hostel-type of accommodation but I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the reception area and especially the room. It had a bathtub! The only bad thing was the bed. It was clean, but not comfortable. It was not soft and the pillows were kinda flat. My semi-double bed at the apartment felt bigger and more comfortable for the both of us. If the bed was more comfortable I would book here again in a heartbeat with my family, but I think I'll check out other hotels first. The receptionists and other people in the lobby were very very accommodating and most spoke great English. Every morning we would talk to them and have them draw in a map the best way to commute to our destinations for the day :) Saved us the hassle and expense of getting lost in HK

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: z_c00l
Reviews.Content: Good impression when I first arrived the hotel. Rooms are clean which is good. But like the others mention, bathroom shower is kinda small. Anyway, stayed here for 2 nights and it's pretty decent. No bed bugs. Staff are friendly and speaks good English. One thing I like about this place that the MTR (monorali) is not too far away. Also, there a huge plaza near by. There is a couple of decent restaurant nearby. Had my breakfast at Cafe de Coral.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelnews4U
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Newton Kowloon for 3 nights while visiting relatives in HK. The hotel is located in the north side of Kowloon, just south of Boundary Street. It is about a 5 minute walk to the Prince Edward MTR station. From there, you can go anywhere in HK or Kowloon. It is also close to Nathan Road which has tons of restaurants and shopping. Also within 5 minutes is the Fa Yuen Street market where you can pick up clothing, toys, accessories, and jewelry at low prices. Bargin if you can! Check-in and check-out were efficient. The staff are friendly, helpful, and speak English. Our room had 2 twin beds (hard by my standards, but OK). Rooms are small and there is not much room to walk around , but it had a TV, lounge chair and a bay window seat which was convenient to store 3 suitcases while still enjoying the view. The bathroom is basic and tiny and can only fit one person at a time. It smelled a bit musty, but it was clean. The soap dispenser in the shower did not work well and no shampoo bottles were in the bathroom. Towels are on the thin side, but overall - the room and bathroom worked for us and our stay was comfortable. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we did not eat there. You also have to pay for internet use. If you want a decent place to stay in Kowloon, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth your monely”
Reviews.Author: cranqee66
Reviews.Content: As most people reviewed, the location of this hotel is not on the busy street on Nathan, yet two blocks away from the Prince Edward MTR station. Room size is okay...very clean. We got a street view room, which was facing the recreation center. Across the street there's a recreation center if you need to run or play basketball. We stayed there for 7 days and no complaints about it. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: pbkoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Newton Kowloon for a week. The room's pretty small - but not as small as the one I stayed in in Tokyo. Quite clean, clean towels provided daily. Location is within 5 minutes to the Prince Edward MTR - very convenient to travel around. Went to Chinese University of HK, Disneyland, the Peak.... all easily negotiated on the MTR links. And Mongkok is a good place to find good food. Within a stone's throw from the hotel are some good restaurants - for Chinese food. Do beware though what you order, and don't let the waiters get you to order really expensive stuff without really knowing what you ordered - always check the menu and pricing first!

Reviews.Title: “Newton Kowloon Hotel is a little tired ....”
Reviews.Author: marivietnam
Reviews.Content: The Newton Kowloon is in an excellent location for using the subways and has many good restaraunts in the neighborhood. Breakfast at the hotel is very good and the staff is wonderful in the restaurant. We found the rooms to be a bit tired and worn .... there is a mould situation in the building which caused some respitory distress. The pictures in the frames were dotted with mould and the musty smells were a bit hard to handle. The beds were very comfortable and the desk staff was very helpful with any questions we had. We would not stay here again as we found this establishment highly overpriced for what we received. We also found that their internet was very highly overpriced at a charge of $80.00 Hong Kong dollars per day....

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lantNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the rooms a reasonable size. Nice view over the sports field. We liked the location, easy access to the rest of the city from Prince Edward MTR. Popular seafood restaurant in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location, View- better if room is bigger- but hey, is Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: NayKat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Newton Kowloon for 4 nights with my husband (note: I am from HK). We got a room high up, facing the sport field - Excellent view. Note - noise problem in HK hotels was never an issue for me since EVERY hotel has central AC on, and the windows are always double pane. But my hubby was really happy with the view. Location is EXCELLENT !! 5-7 min to MTR station. Restaurants nearby. Yes, it is in the middle of the road, but as mentioned before, it is conviently located and noise was NOT an issue. Room was nice, looks more like a "hotel" then a "motel", no "run-down" feeling at all though is "3 star". We only hope that the room is a little bit bigger, ours has a double (queen) bed, which we learned, next time, get a 2 separate beds bedroom to have more space to lay things out and move around. In general, recommended for the price and the value. Paid about 550 HKD for 1 night. and Yes, we plan to stay there again for our next trip (If my target hotel - longham in MongKok does not have a special then, we will stay at Newton again).

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon Newton -”
Reviews.Author: doreenie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kowloon Newton for 5 nights in May 2007. No big complaints except that the bed were a little too firm. And they didn't have a Queen, only 2 twins. We requested a higher floor (12th) to avoid noises, and we got the view of residences. From airport we took a bus shuttle at arrival counter B01. About $110 HKD pp. Not much around the hotel but there is a 7-11 for snacks/drinks. 5 mins walk to Prince Jordan station MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Newton Hotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Bestinshow
Reviews.Content: Hello Folks, Not much to complain about w this middle of the road hotel, found the location to be very nice for early morning walks, close proximity to flower market...the staff are ok nothing to write home about, taxi fare from here to Central HK about $72 which is cheap....our room was fair size about 9 X 14, bathroom is not big enough for two people...room service very efficient in making room up w fresh towels, fridge in room, flat screen TV had terrible english language channels, news all the time...baaa and no movies the whole week, oh well, would i stay at this hotel again...probably not...buy if you're on a budget this hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to the MTR”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVoyager
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to provide a quick review since there are no other comments on this hotel. I stayed at the Newton Kowloon four times in August-September, 2004. The hotel is located in the north of Mong Kok, close to the Prince Edward MTR station. This is definitely not a touristy area, but the nearby MTR station, 7-Elevens and dry cleaners covered all my bases. The hotel is somewhat old but very clean. The rates offered excellent value. Certain areas, such as the coffee shop, were being renovated toward the end of our stay so I cannot comment on them. The rooms were small but included the essentials: mini-fridge, a desk, in-room safe and coffee maker. The mirrors in the bathrooms are heated, which is great to get rid of the steam on them from the bath/shower. There was TV, but with no cable connection there were only three English-language TV stations and a handful of Cantonese and Mandarin stations. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The front desk arranged safe-keeping of bags between stays and provided advice on nearby amenities (such as the cleaners). We had a view of the nearby soccer field and some mountains off in the distance each stay. I appreciated the view given the rather cramped quarters in most of the city. Overall, the Newton Hotel Kowloon is a great hotel for budget-conscious travellers.

HotelInfo.Name: Newton Hotel Kowloon
HotelInfo.Address: No.66 Boundary Street, Mongkok, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
